result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M. Boutell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit to DNA sample.  Undergo any domestic abuse and anger management counseling and any other counseling per agent.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph M. Boutell in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tsai gives status.  Matter is resolved and Attorney Tsai gives recommendation.  Plea to Count 1 & 2.  Dismiss read in Count 3 and the modifier.    No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Victim statement reviewed.  Attorney Tsai gives final statement.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1 & 2:
18 months Probation, concurrent.
Submit to domestic abuse and anger management counseling
Submit to DNA sample
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
$243.00 costs x 2 and $200.00 DNA surcharge x 2 & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.
Count 3 dismissed read in.
Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Requests reset, not resolved.    Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial

Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tsai requests reset to review offer w/his client.  State hesitates as this was already reset for that reason.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tsai requests reset and files authorization.  Needs time to meet w/his client.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 07-17-2015 11:15 am.
Return date at 07-28-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Joseph M. Boutell in court.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney, waived to receive offer today, however no offer to extend.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date. $850.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 11:15 am.  Return date scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
